result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas J Schrader was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: DNA sample and surcharge were assessed in 2013CF194.

Absolute sobriety. 
No contact with any codefendants unless approved by agent.

Assessment/counseling/treatment deemed appropriate by agent.
Jail credit applies if revoked from probation. 

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been faxed to the probation office.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Includes: 14CF1 and 14CM503
State appears by ADA Lance Leonhard.  Def appears with Atty Rick Cveykus and Atty Pauline Toulouse.
Court notes there is a substitution of attorneys in the file and Court signs order and Atty Toulouse is excused. 
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW
State moves to: 14CM503>>Count 2>>DRI
Court grants.
PLEA: 14CF1>>Count 1>>Possession of Meth/Repeater>>No Contest
14CM503>>Count 1>>Retail Theft>>No Contest
COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty. 
COURT ORDERS: 14CF1>>WS; Probation for 18 months (concurrent) and 14CM503>>WS; Probation for 1 year (concurrent) with Conditions in both of: Assessment/Counseling/Treatment deemed appropriate by agent, CC, AODA, absolute sobriety, FTE/School, No contact with codefendants unless approved by agent, DNA sample and surcharge in felony conviction if not already done. Has 3 days credit on the felony case.
